forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 74. West wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 58. West southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the air is clear, kissed by the lingering warmth of the late afternoon sun as it drifts toward the horizon. With a high of about 74, one can almost feel the soft embrace of a gentle breeze from the west, harmonizing with the soft murmur of the bay below. As evening beckons, the sky remains mostly clear, promising a comfortable night around 58 degrees. The west-southwest wind, light yet persistent, rustles the leaves in the trees, hinting at the quieter moments yet to come.

Despite the usual expectations of fog that sometimes drapes the Golden Gate, today presents a different canvas—one where the clarity is almost palpable, inviting those who appreciate a sunset stroll. For those drawn to the outdoors, there is evidence of life in the bustling street corners and serene parks, perfect for an unobtrusive gathering with friends or perhaps a solitary moment at one of the quieter spots along the waterfront. A light jacket will suffice as the daylight fades, creating a balance of comfort and ease. It’s a beautiful evening, one that encourages you to indulge in simple pleasures—so take a moment to inhale the salty air and savor the transition into night.
